comment.author: 39005746@N00
comment._content: As well as being a nationalist and actress she is often refered to in the context of her turbulent relationship with the Irish poet William Bulter Yeats. Her son Seán MacBride was a founding  member of Amnesty International and received the Nobel Peace Prize in 1974.

comment.author: 7711591@N04
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Historic Heroines, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 38123137@N00
comment._content: Delightful Maude Gonne image. Do JOIN us. Add this in WM. PHILLIPS [1825-1911] "ECO-CENTENARY 2011" - UK-IRELAND-ITALY: ADD1-3: AWARD-COMMENT 1. London-born, Phillips toured Italy with friends - met Garibaldi. He worked for International Peace with Miss Gonne in 1889-90s. At home, he was best man to Opera conductor, Enrico Bevignani. An Auctioneer & Coal trader, and later a reformer-environmentalist, advocate of free education; park concert gazebos, and trees as community lungs. A humanitarian, Phillips campaigned for Lancashire’s starving cotton-workers, and as a J.P. of Galway, enlisted his family in Famine Relief, to impoverished cottagers. Phillips moved to S. London to raise a family In the 1860s. - 4. William Phillips, Forest Hill . . . Be a volunteer. * *Assist in events, or help promote our 2011 Italian-UK-Irish ECO-CENTENARY festival. Find eco-living SPONSORS. * * More on Phillips’ life, family, etc. - 1. General Introduction . We hope this eco-living festival will raise new social inspiration. Please OPEN *ALL SIZES* + Add tag: William-Phillips-Eco-Centenary-2011 * * Add me as CONTACT / FRIEND * * || * Thanks too for giving our group AWARDS - INVITING great images! * ||
